poem:
Title: Fruit of Silence and Shadows

They pulled four shadows from the river's mouth,
Trading lives for golden orbs of truth,
Christmas Eve brought whispers of a stealthy south,
Suborned silence, fruited with uncouth.

Benevolence in bribes, concealing grief,
Ghosts adrift in Thika's vast terrain,
Pineapple caves echoing of faithless thief,
Carols of despair, songs of silent pain.
